definition: the full light of day (idiom)/fig. peace and prosperity/in broad daylight
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: So nowadays mugging in broad daylight are called conquest. ?
sentences.chinese: 所以现在光天化日之下的抢劫被称为征服？

sentences.english: They even committed such crimes in broad daylight.
sentences.chinese: 他们竟敢在光天化日之下犯这种罪行。

sentences.english: You're chasing two men with a gun in broad daylight.
sentences.chinese: 光天化日下你竟拿着枪追着两个人。

sentences.english: And the neighbors were dancing outside coked out and naked.
sentences.chinese: 邻居在光天化日之下裸体跳舞和嗑药。

sentences.english: They robbed the bank in broad daylight.
sentences.chinese: 他们在光天化日之下就抢劫银行。

sentences.english: The man must be as bold as brass to have stolen money at mid-day.
sentences.chinese: 这男子胆大包天，居然在中午光天化日下偷钱。
夫人，光天化日之下你想玩死我啊？

sentences.english: Loan shot the man in the head in broad daylight on the street in Saigon.
sentences.chinese: 楼在光天化日的西贡大街上朝那人头部开枪。

sentences.english: Drug deals are often conducted openly, without even a pretense of cover-up.
sentences.chinese: 毒品交易经常毫无遮掩的在光天化日之下进行。

sentences.english: They robbed the jewelry store in broad daylight.
sentences.chinese: 他们在光天化日之下抢劫珠宝商店。

sentences.english: I was robbed in  broad daylight last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年，我在光天化日之下遭到抢劫。

sentences.english: The fact stood out cut in stetl on the pitiless daylight.
sentences.chinese: 在无情的光天化日下，这个事实是确凿无疑的。

sentences.english: The robbers struck the bank in broad daylight!
sentences.chinese: 盗匪在光天化日之下，洗劫银行。

sentences.english: Why do it there in broad daylight?
sentences.chinese: 为什么他要在光天化日低下呢？

sentences.english: She believed no one would attack a woman in broad daylight.
sentences.chinese: 她不相信有人会光天化日之下侵犯一个女人。

definition: in broad daylight/in the middle of the day/KMT emblem, a white sun on a blue background
see 萬目睽睽|万目睽睽[wan4 mu4 kui2 kui2]
in the middle of the street/facing the street
to have no sense of shame/brazen
worse than a beast/to behave immorally
the law/the law of the land/the law of a state (in former times)/criterion
to have the impertinence/to have the cheek to
